name: Inula
Relationship: Compare: CROCUS; IGNATIA; ARUM DRACONTIUM (loose cough worse at night on lying down).

Head: Vertigo on stooping; throbbing after eating, pressure in temples and forehead
Respiratory: Chronic bronchitis; cough with much thick expectoration, with languor and weak digestion
Dry cough; worse at night and lying down; larynx painful
Teasing cough with much and free expectoration
Rectum: Pressing toward rectum as of something extruding
Urine: Frequent urging to urinate; passes only in drops
Female: Moving about in abdomen, stitches in genitals
Labor-like pains; urging to stool; dragging in genitals, with violent backache
Itching of legs during menses, chattering of teeth from cold during menstruation
Extremities: Pain in right shoulder and wrist; tearing in left palm, unable to double fingers; pain in lower limbs, feet and ankles

details: A mucous membrane medicine. Bearing-down sensation in pelvic organs and bronchial symptoms are most marked. Substernal pain. Diabetes.
